Committed to the Environment

Photo: Martin Rowe

The Kenyan biologist Wangari Maathai wanted to combat the poverty that deforestation was causing in her country. To do this, he began planting trees and invited others to imitate the initiative.

Thus, with its Green Belt project, it promoted the planting of more than 47 million trees in Africa.

In 2004, he received the Nobel Peace Prize for his advocacy of sustainable development and the environment.
